intro: Epilobium valdiviense var. alboffii, commonly known as the white-flowered willow herb, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy white or pale pink flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in riverbanks and wetlands. This variant is distinguished by its pale floral coloration, which sets it apart from other varieties within the Epilobium genus.
